DataElement.preferredName: Patient Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire How Often Conversation with Oncologist About Cancer Prognosis 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often they have had a conversation with their oncologist about the likely outcome of their cancer over time, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire How Often Conversation with Oncologist About Cancer Prognosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period._A question about whether a person had a conversation with their oncologist about the prognosis of the patient's cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Patient Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Property.preferredName: Temporal Frequency Conversation with Oncologist About Cancer Prognosis
Property.preferredDefinition: The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.:A question about whether a person had a conversation with their oncologist about the prognosis of the patient's cancer.

Concepts.definition: The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.

Concepts.longName: Conversation with Oncologist About Cancer Prognosis
Concepts.definition: A question about whether a person had a conversation with their oncologist about the prognosis of the patient's cancer.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard with five text responses related to how often something happens from never to very often.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On most occasions, or in most situations.

Concepts.definition: On most occasions, or in most situations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

Concepts.definition: On many occasions, or in many situations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added "Sometimes" to represent the MSAS value domain.ghd.01.27.15

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How often have you had a conv
ReferenceDocuments.description: How often have you had a conversation with your oncologist about the likely outcome of your cancer over time (i.e. your prognosis)?

DataElement.origin: PTPQ:Prognosis and Treatment Perceptions Questionnaire as referenced in Associations Among Prognostic Understanding, Quality of Life, El-Jawahri A, et.al., 2014
